data.chText: （使）变平；把…弄平
data.enText: to become or make sth become flat or flatter

data.chText: 曲奇烤时会略微变平。
data.enText: The cookies will flatten slightly while cooking.

data.chText: 这些身体锻炼有助腹部变平。
data.enText: These exercises will help to flatten your stomach.

data.chText: 他用发胶把头发弄平。
data.enText: He flattened his hair down with gel.

data.chText: 摧毁，推倒，弄倒（建筑物、树木等）
data.enText: to destroy or knock down a building, tree, etc.

data.chText: 工厂的大部分被爆炸夷为平地。
data.enText: Most of the factory was flattened by the explosion.

data.chText: 轻易击败
data.enText: to defeat sb easily in a competition, an argument, etc.

data.chText: 今晚我们队被打得落花流水！
data.enText: Our team was flattened this evening!

data.chText: 击倒；打倒
data.enText: to hit sb very hard so that they fall down

data.chText: 他一拳就把闯入者打倒在地。
data.enText: He flattened the intruder with a single punch.

data.chText: 你要再那样我就把你揍趴下！
data.enText: I'll flatten you if you do that again!
flatten sth/yourself against/on sb/sth

data.chText: 使平贴；把…紧贴着
data.enText: to press sth/your body against sb/sth

data.chText: 她把鼻子紧贴着窗户朝里瞧。
data.enText: She flattened her nose against the window and looked in.

data.chText: 格雷格身体紧靠着墙让我通过。
data.enText: Greg flattened himself against the wall to let me pass.
flatten out

data.chText: 逐渐变平
data.enText: to gradually become completely flat

data.chText: 山峦起初拔地而起，然后逐渐平坦，伸向大海。
data.enText: The hills first rose steeply then flattened out towards the sea.

data.chText: 停止生长；不再长高；停止上升
data.enText: to stop growing or going up

data.chText: 出口增长已逐渐缓了下来。
data.enText: Export growth has started to flatten out.
flatten sth↔out

data.chText: 使变平
data.enText: to make sth completely flat

means: 摧毁，推倒，弄倒(建筑物、树木等)

ex.chText: 为什么饼干在烤的时候会略微变平呢？
ex.enText: Why do biscuits flatten slightly while cooking?

ex.chText: 你最好用擀面杖把面团擀平。
ex.enText: You'd better use the rolling pin to flatten the dough.

ex.chText: 敌人的轰炸机把这座城市夷为平地。
ex.enText: The enemy bombers have flattened the city.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指物体变平或使物体变平；也指通过撞击、轰炸等将建筑物、树木等夷平。

ex.chText: 工人们设法把地面弄平整了。
ex.enText: The workers managed to level/flatten the floor.

ex.chText: 炸弹把一半城市夷为平地。
ex.enText: Bombs levelled/flattened half of the city.

synonyms.bx: 只作及物动词，指将某物弄平整，或摧毁、夷平建筑物等，常可与 flatten 换用。

ex.chText: 他先把纸抹平，然后开始在上面写字。
ex.enText: He smoothed out the paper and then began to write on it.

ex.chText: 她帮儿子把所有的褶皱弄平整。
ex.enText: She helped her son to smooth out all the wrinkles.

synonyms.bx: 指用手把纸、布等弄平整。

data.enText: flatten sth/yourself against/on sb/sth

data.chText: 使平贴；把…紧贴着
data.enText: to press sth/your body against sb/sth

data.chText: 她把鼻子紧贴着窗户朝里瞧。
data.enText: She flattened her nose against the window and looked in.

data.chText: 格雷格身体紧靠着墙让我通过。
data.enText: Greg flattened himself against the wall to let me pass.
flatten out

data.chText: 逐渐变平
data.enText: to gradually become completely flat

data.chText: 山峦起初拔地而起，然后逐渐平坦，伸向大海。
data.enText: The hills first rose steeply then flattened out towards the sea.

data.chText: 停止生长；不再长高；停止上升
data.enText: to stop growing or going up

data.chText: 出口增长已逐渐缓了下来。
data.enText: Export growth has started to flatten out.
flatten sth↔out

data.chText: 使变平
data.enText: to make sth completely flat

example: flatten your stomach with these exercises

value.def: If you flatten something or if it flattens, it becomes flat or flatter.

example.ex: He carefully flattened the wrappers and put them between the leaves of his book...
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地把包装纸弄平，夹在书页里。

example.ex: The dog's ears flattened slightly as Cook spoke his name.
example.tran: 库克叫这只狗的名字时，它的耳朵就会稍稍耷拉一下。

example.ex: ...the pitiful shacks built of cardboard boxes, corrugated iron sheets and flattened oil drums.
example.tran: 用硬纸盒、波纹铁皮和压扁的油桶搭起来的简陋棚屋

example.ex: The hills flattened out just south of the mountain...
example.tran: 丘陵就在大山以南变得平坦起来。

example.ex: We now think prices will flatten out towards the end of this year...
example.tran: 我们现在认为到今年年底价格会趋于平稳。

example.ex: Peel off the blackened skin, flatten the pepper out and trim it into edible pieces.
example.tran: 把发黑的皮削掉，把甜椒压扁，切成可以入口的小块。

value.def: To flatten something such as a building, town, or plant means to destroy it by knocking it down or crushing it.

example.ex: ...explosives capable of flattening a five-storey building.
example.tran: 能将一幢 5 层高的楼房夷为平地的炸药

example.ex: ...bombing raids flattened much of the area.
example.tran: 空袭将这个地区的大部分都夷为了平地

value.tran: 摧毁，弄倒，夷平(建筑、城镇或植物)

value.def: If you flatten yourself against something, you press yourself flat against it, for example to avoid getting in the way or being seen.

example.ex: He flattened himself against a brick wall as I passed.
example.tran: 他紧贴一面砖墙站着好让我通过。

value.tran: 使紧贴;使贴着(以免挡路或被看见)

value.def: If you flatten someone, you make them fall over by hitting them violently.

example.ex: 'I've never seen a woman flatten someone like that,' said a crew member. 'She knocked him out cold.'
example.tran: “我从没见过一个女人那样把人打趴下，”一位机组人员说，“她把他完全打昏了。”

value.def: If you flatten someone in a fight, contest, or argument, you defeat them completely.

example.ex: In the squash court his chief aim is to flatten me...
example.tran: 在壁球场上他的主要目标就是击败我。

example.ex: A large percentage of these forces had been flattened by the assault.
example.tran: 这些部队大部分都已经在这次进攻中被击溃。

value.tran: (在争斗、竞赛或辩论中)击败，打败，战胜
